issues.title: Missing Administrative Regulation for Library Media Centers
issues.description: The Board Policy delegates implementation responsibilities to administrative regulation but no AR 6163.1 exists. The policy references procedures for selection and evaluation of library materials, complaint procedures, and implementation of library plans that require detailed administrative procedures to be compliant.

legal_citations.text: The governing board of any school district may initiate and carry on any program, activity, or may otherwise act in any manner which is not in conflict with or inconsistent with, or preempted by, any law and which is not in conflict with the purposes for which school districts are established.

issues.required_language: Administrative Regulation 6163.1 must be created to establish detailed procedures for: (1) selection and evaluation of library materials including specific criteria and process steps, (2) development and implementation of districtwide library plans, (3) development of classroom library plans for grades K-4, (4) complaint procedures for library materials, and (5) annual reporting requirements to the California Department of Education.

issues.title: Missing Detailed Material Selection Procedures
issues.description: While BP 6163.1 delegates responsibility for selection procedures to the Superintendent, no detailed procedures exist for the systematic selection and evaluation of library materials as required by professional library standards and referenced in the policy.

legal_citations.text: School libraries may provide assistance to teachers and students in the evaluation, selection, production, and uses of instructional materials and a collection of materials and resources that support the curriculum and are appropriate for user needs.

issues.required_language: Detailed procedures must specify: (1) criteria for material selection including curriculum alignment, age appropriateness, and quality standards, (2) process for soliciting recommendations from stakeholders, (3) evaluation methods and professional selection aids to be used, (4) approval workflow and documentation requirements, and (5) procedures for material removal and replacement.

issues.title: Missing Library Material Complaint Procedures
issues.description: The policy references that complaints regarding library materials shall use "the district's procedures for complaints regarding instructional materials" but does not specify what those procedures are or ensure they address library-specific considerations.

legal_citations.text: Each school district shall establish procedures for receiving and investigating complaints and for remedying any valid complaints.

issues.required_language: Specific procedures must be established for handling complaints about library materials including: (1) formal complaint form and submission process, (2) review committee composition including library professionals, (3) evaluation criteria and timeline for review, (4) appeal process, and (5) interim procedures for challenged materials during review.

issues.title: Missing Annual Reporting Procedures
issues.description: While the policy requires annual reporting to the California Department of Education by August 31, no procedures exist for data collection, compilation, and submission of the required library condition reports.

legal_citations.text: The district shall, on or before August 31 each year, report to the California Department of Education on the condition of school libraries for the preceding year ending June 30.

issues.required_language: Procedures must establish: (1) data collection requirements and responsible parties at each school site, (2) reporting format and required information elements, (3) timeline for data compilation and review, (4) approval process for final report, and (5) submission procedures to the California Department of Education.
